name: Text Classification
instruction: To create a language model for text classification, start by preprocessing the text data. This includes tokenization, stopwords removal, stemming, and lemmatization. Then, train the model on the preprocessed data. This can be done using supervised classification algorithms such as Support Vector Machines, Naive Bayes, and Logistic Regression. Finally, evaluate the model’s performance using metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.
author: Atlas Unified

name: Summarization
instruction: Install the NLTK library to create the language model. Then, design the model by creating a corpus, tokenizing the text, and defining the algorithm for summarization. Finally, store the language model and use it to generate summaries for documents.
